Description of incident: "We are writing to inform you of a recent incident involving a breach of your personallyidentifiable information.  On November 27, 2015, a consumer reported that she had been given your user name and passcode by a Navigator who was trying to assist the consumer with her application.  The consumer, who has the same name as yours, reported she had accessed your account and found the information was incorrect.  Upon learning of the mistake, a customer service representative immediately changed your account passcode so that no further access could be gained.  Your application contained personally identifiable information such as you and your dependent’s name, address, dates of birth, social security numbers, gender, ethnicity and race as well as your address, phone number, email address, annual income amount and citizenship status.We became aware of the incident on November 27, 2015 We take the protection of the privacy and security of your personally identifiable information very seriously.  Upon discovery, an investigation was initiated into the cause of the incident and found that the Navigator failed to perform redundant checks, such as asking the consumer her name, date of birth, and address to ensure the Navigator was opening the correct account."More Information: https://www.oag.state.md.us/idtheft/Breach%20Notices/2015/itu-262365.pdf
